motivationalSlogan0: Turn each task into a step towards success!
motivationalSlogan1: Productivity is not an accident, it's the result of effort!
motivationalSlogan2: Each completed task is a small victory on the path to success!
motivationalSlogan3: Do the hard things today, they'll be easy tomorrow!
motivationalSlogan5: Small actions every day create big results!
motivationalSlogan6: Discipline is the bridge between goals and accomplishment!
motivationalSlogan7: Success comes from turning hard tasks into habits!
noTasksFound: No tasks found. Create your first task to get started!
productivityTipText: Prioritize your important and difficult tasks early in the day when your energy is high. The Pomodoro Technique (working in focused 25-minute sessions with 5-minute breaks) can help you maintain focus and productivity.
expenseCategoriesDesc: Breakdown of your expenses by category
weeklySpendingDesc: Your spending pattern over the past month
budgetTrackingDesc: Monitor your spending against your monthly budgets
trackYourProgress: Track your progress towards your personal and professional goals
nextSteps: Your next steps towards achieving your goals
milestonesCompletionTip: Completing milestones regularly increases your chances of achieving goals by 80%
goalSettingScienceDesc: Research shows that people who explicitly set goals are 10x more likely to achieve them than those who don't. Breaking down goals into smaller milestones activates your brain's reward system with each completion.
higherSuccessRate: Higher success rate when goals are tracked visually and reviewed weekly
trackDailyHabits: Track your daily habits and build consistent routines
completeTasksToMaintain: Complete these tasks to maintain your streaks
maintainingStreak66Days: Maintaining a streak for 66 days is proven to form a lasting habit
habitFormationDesc: Research shows that it takes an average of 66 days to form a new habit. Visual streak tracking leverages the psychological principle of "loss aversion" - we're more motivated to avoid breaking a streak than to start a new one.
visualStreakTrackingBenefit: People with visual streak tracking are 21 times more likely to maintain daily habits
keepGoingToClimb: Keep going to climb the ranks!
rankingsBasedOnWeek: Rankings based on points earned this week
rankingsBasedOnMonth: Rankings based on points earned this month
monthlyLeaderboardData: Monthly leaderboard data would be displayed here with similar structure to weekly
allTimeLeaderboardData: All-time leaderboard data would be displayed here with similar structure to weekly
trackHabitsRoutines: Track your habits and build consistent routines
completeHabitsToMaintain: Complete these habits to maintain your streaks
habitFormationTime: Research shows that it takes an average of 66 days to form a new habit
atomicHabitsDescription: According to research by James Clear, author of "Atomic Habits", small habits compound over time. The effects of your habits multiply as you repeat them. They seem to make little difference on any given day but the impact they deliver over months and years can be enormous.
onePercentBetterCompound: Getting 1% better every day compounds to a 37x improvement over a year
